Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the Affordable Care Act on job growth by stating that 90% of job growth has been in full-time positions, without mentioning the percentage of part-time job growth.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the statement that 90% of job growth has been in full-time positions.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Affordable Care Act is the primary factor driving job growth and the shift towards full-time positions, without considering other potential factors or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not address or consider alternative explanations for the increase in full-time job growth, such as changes in the overall economic climate or other policies impacting job creation.
